title: Everyday English Course 99
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: When did the man see Jim?

answerOptions: Both of them are laymen of modern art.
She has beamed to appreciate modem sculptures.
Italian artists' works are difficult to understand.
instances.correctAnswer: She has beamed to appreciate modem sculptures.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

answerOptions: To find a better science journal in the library.
Not to subscribe to the journal.
To buy the latest issue of the magazine.
instances.correctAnswer: Not to subscribe to the journal.

variables.a: What is the woman's advice to the man?

answerOptions: He has to go to work.

variables.a: What does the man usually do on Saturdays?

answerOptions: He will only be available in the afternoon.

variables.a: Why can't professor Hill answer her question now?
What does the man want to do?
What is the man doing?
What is Gary trying to collect money for?
Who did the man buy the books for?
When did the woman go to Australia?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: What's Mr. Black's job?

answerOptions: She didn't do well at high school.

variables.a: What does the man remember of Sally?
What's wrong with Lily?

answerOptions: He can't attend the two-day meeting.
He can't attend the meeting on Monday.
He can attend the meeting on either day.
instances.correctAnswer: He can attend the meeting on either day.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

answerOptions: Something is wrong with his heart.
instances.correctAnswer: Something is wrong with his heart.

variables.a: What's wrong with David?
What kind of person is Richard?
What are the two speakers talking about?
The woman is going to the ________.

answerOptions: John will have a class at 21: 00.
John will go to the library at 2:00.

variables.a: What is John going to do?

answerOptions: Apply for a job in the electronics company.
Visit the electronics company next week.
Get apart-time job on campus before graduation.
instances.correctAnswer: Apply for a job in the electronics company.

variables.a: What does the woman want to do?

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: She prefers the artists she has studied.
She hopes they will take some of the paintings away.
She hasn't gone to see the exhibit yet.
instances.correctAnswer: She hasn't gone to see the exhibit yet.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

answerOptions: It is open till four on Sundays.
He doesn't know its business hours.
instances.correctAnswer: It is open till four on Sundays.

variables.a: What does the man say about the post office?
What are they going to do?

answerOptions: Yes, he liked it very much.
He didn't go there at all.
instances.correctAnswer: He didn't go there at all.

variables.a: Did the man enjoy the concert yesterday?

questionTemplates.text_en:
F: What are you reading, Bill?
M: It's this week's New Scientist. Why?
F: I was just wondering. It looks interesting, but I've never actually read it myself. It's for real scientists, or can ordinary people like me understand it?
M: Oh, it's for anyone really. It usually has articles and stories about current affairs about science, as well as papers about new developments in research, I'm reading about a new telephone that allows you to see the person you are speaking to, as well as hear him.
F: Oh, I've heard about it. Is it on the market yet? Can I buy one?
M: No, not this one. But the company has made other models to try out on business. This one is special because of its color, and the images moving.
F: Oh, that's interesting.
M: You see, the first videophones--that's what they are called--were made in Japan. But they can only show a still black-and-white image, so this videophone is much better than that. Mind you, I'm not sure I'd want one, would you?
F: Well, no. I don't think I would. I bet it costs a lot of money. Does it say how much it costs?
M: Yes. The early black-and-white ones cost several hundred pounds. But the one is about costs several thousand pounds.
F: Hum. Why does anybody want one, do you think?
M: Business organizations that need to frequently contact overseas organizations would want it. It's like a face-to-face conversation. So maybe a lot of overseas travel can be avoided.
F: Yes, I suppose so.
{a}

answerOptions: It is difficult for ordinary people to read.
It usually has articles about current affairs about science.
instances.correctAnswer: It is difficult for ordinary people to read.

variables.a: The following statements about the magazine New Scientist is true EXCEPT ______.

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: What a fine day today!
W: Oh, I think so.
M: Shall we go to boat there?
W: Good idea. Let's go.
{a}

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: I want to go to London.
W: A round trip ticket would be cheaper. I can also arrange hotel reservations and guided tour, if you'd like.
M: A round trip ticket, please.
{a}
